description: Documentation for 9.7.16.10.4. Packing formats of elements in Tensor and Shared memory

files.title: 9.7.16.10.4.1. Packing format for matrix D in Tensor Memory
files.summary: The sub-word elements of matrix `D` are expected not to be packed within a 32-bit Tensor Memory word. For example, if the type of elements of the matrix `D` is 16 bits then a Tensor Memory word would contain a single 16-bit element in its lower 16 bits.

files.title: 9.7.16.10.4.2. Packing format for matrix A and B
files.summary: The 6-bit and 4-bit floating point types have different packing format requirements for different MMA kinds in both Tensor memory and Shared memory. The requirements are as follows.

files.title: 9.7.16.10.4.3. Packing format used for matrix A by .kind::mxf8f6f4 in Tensor Memory
files.summary: The individual 4-bit and the 6-bit floating point type elements must be packed in an 8-bit container in Tensor memory as shown below. The 8-bit containers must be contiguously packed in a 32-bit Tensor Memory word. For example, if the type of elements of the matrix `A` is 6 bits then 4 consecutiv...

files.title: 9.7.16.10.4.4. Packing format used for matrix A and B by .kind::mxf8f6f4 in Shared Memory
files.summary: The 4-bit and 6-bit floating point elements in shared memory must be contiguously packed along with padding as follows.

files.title: 9.7.16.10.4.5. Packing format used for matrix A by .kind::mxf4 and .kind::mxf4nvf4 in Tensor Memory
files.summary: Two 4-bit floating point type elements must be packed in an 8-bit container in Tensor memory as shown in [Figure 204](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/parallel-thread-execution/#tcgen05-packing-formats-mxf4-tmem-dig1) for `mxf4`.

files.title: 9.7.16.10.4.6. Packing format used for matrix A and B by .kind::mxf4 and .kind::mxf4nvf4 in Shared Memory
files.summary: The packing format for 4-bit floating point elements in shared memory is to pack two 4-bit elements in a 8-bit container, with no padding.
